title: Drawing, "Design for inkstand", 1800–25
medium: Brush and yellow, red, grey watercolor, black wash, graphite, on cream laid paper
inscribed:
Below center, brown ink: No. 53855; graphite: 53855
Upper left, graphite: A or V, sideways
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Rectangular black base supports a box, drawer in open position (at right). Box decorated with center mask flanked by stylized leaf motifs. On top of box, a crouching black figure, two arrows at his back, reaching towards a classical vase, a flat circular bowl at right.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for inkstand", 1800–25.
1800–25. Brush and yellow, red, grey watercolor, black wash, graphite, on cream laid paper. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1931-64-155.
